metadata.title: CVE-2016-9074 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
An existing mitigation of timing side-channel attacks is insufficient insome circumstances. This issue is addressed in Network Security Services(NSS) 3.26.1. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 45.5, Firefox ESR <45.5, and Firefox < 50.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9074` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss3 - 2:3.26.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
libnss3-1d - 2:3.26.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
libnss3-nssdb - 2:3.26.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
libnss3-tools - 2:3.26.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nss package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:3.26.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3').
